page.title: 02ORGANIZATION OF EDUCATION
page.content: The area has a three tier educational system comprising lower (5-8+ years) middle (9-13+ years) and upper (14-18 years) schools. The upper school is also designated a community college, providing education for examination and leisure for those who seek it in the community at large, in addition to its function as a school for the compulsory age group to 16 years old, and also providing a sixth form education for the 16-18 year olds who wish to further their education. The area has ten schools, 7 lower, 2 middle and one upper. They are concentrated in an area approximately one third of the whole area, indicating the concentration of population in the area. Each school designs its own curriculum in accordance with guidelines from the Bedfordshire Education Authority.
